block.p: Jane Mills Timberlake, the daughter of Kate M. Timberlake and Terrill V. Timberlake of Burlingame, Calif., was married there yesterday to Taylor Scott Walker, a son of Diana H. Walker and O. Mallory Walker Jr. of Washington. The Rev. Stuart Coxhead Jr. performed the ceremony at St. Paul's Episcopal Church.
The couple operate the A-1 Product Company, a tableware manufacturer in Burlingame. Ms. Timberlake, who is keeping her name, is the president and designer, and Mr. Walker runs the business side.

Jane Mills Timberlake, the daughter of Kate M. Timberlake and Terrill V. Timberlake of Burlingame, Calif., was married there yesterday to Taylor Scott Walker, a son of Diana H. Walker and O. Mallory Walker Jr. of Washington. The Rev. Stuart Coxhead Jr. performed the ceremony at St. Paul's Episcopal Church.
The couple operate the A-1 Product Company, a tableware manufacturer in Burlingame. Ms. Timberlake, who is keeping her name, is the president and designer, and Mr. Walker runs the business side.

The bride, 34, graduated from the Art Center College of Design in Pasadena, Calif. Her father retired as a vice president for sales at the Guittard Chocolate Company, a family business in San Francisco.

The bridegroom, also 34, taught history and outdoor education at the Head-Royce School in Oakland, Calif., until June. He graduated from Hampden-Sydney College and received a master's degree in education from Harvard University. His mother is a White House photographer for Time magazine. His father is the president of Walker & Dunlop, a mortgage banking and corporate real estate company in Washington.
